revised_title: Subtropical Gyre Ventilation and Circulation: Insights from Anthropogenic Tritium and Helium-3
tldr: This article uses the distribution of anthropogenic tritium and helium-3 in the subtropical North Atlantic to study ocean circulation and ventilation. The authors find clear evidence of gyre circulation and estimate the rates of circulation on timescales from months to decades. They also present a time-series of measurements near Bermuda, demonstrating that the mixed layer is supersaturated in helium-3, which has implications for the vertical transport of materials within and from the permanent thermocline.
